sentences.en: He began his professional life as an accountant, the very model of respectability and conservatism.
sentences.cn: 他开始了会计师的职业生涯，一份典型的体面而保守的工作。

sentences.en: He was a vociferous opponent of Conservatism.
Its demerits are related to the author's feudal conservatism and outlook limitations.
sentences.cn: 但它也有一些倒退,这与作者的封建卫道思想和生活见闻的局限有关.

sentences.en: Jones himself was a curious mixture of ra-dicalism and conservatism.
sentences.cn: 琼斯自己是个奇特的混合体，既保守又激进。

sentences.en: people’s innate conservatism in matters of language
sentences.cn: 人们在语言方面天生的守旧

sentences.en: Political polarisation in industrialised countries has fuelled a resurgence of fiscal conservatism.
sentences.cn: 各工业国国内的政治两极分化,促使财政保守主义再度抬头.
波特酒是对他的保守主义的赞美.

sentences.en: Such a defence is rooted in the innate conservatism of the economic profession.
sentences.cn: 这种辩护根植于经济学专业固有的保守主义.

sentences.en: The book is anodd combination of audacity andintense conservatism.
sentences.cn: 那本书很怪,所谈内容既很大胆,又非常保守.

sentences.en: the innate conservatism of older people
The most recent - ism advanced by Mr Osborne and others is " progressive conservatism "
sentences.cn: 新近由奥思本先生和另外一些人提出的“主义”是 “ 进步保守主义 ”

sentences.en: Their adamantine conservatism is the slow outgrowth of this experience.
sentences.cn: 这种经历缓慢地培育了他们顽固的保守主义.

sentences.en: There is usually a trend to conservatism in prosperous eras.
sentences.cn: 在繁荣时期常趋于保守.

sentences.en: To some extent, it has something of conservatism complying with reality, and rejects idealism and transcendentalism.
sentences.cn: 它体现出与现实认同的保守主义倾向, 并拒斥理想主义和超验价值.

sentences.en: We previously have made reference to the accounting concept of conservatism.
sentences.cn: 我们以前提过会计稳健性原则.

sentences.en: Wherein lies the difference between conservatism and liberalism?
sentences.cn: 保守主义和自由主义的区别在哪里？

trans.tran_cn: 保守主义，守旧性，〈英〉保守党（的主张]）
trans.tran_en: dislike of change and new ideas
